commits.message:
Revert "Check and restore error/exception global handlers"

This reverts commit 93aa92b9a1c77476e97ac1832e58907017f7ee28.

Reapply "Check and restore error/exception global handlers"

This reverts commit 23c16c1ce51fbaf05569321094532b428bf5fbd8.
Fix lines explode in EventLogger for non-native EOL

Only consider test outcome (errored, failed, incomplete, skipped, or passed) for TestDox format and display details about test issues, when requested, using the default result printer.

Closes #5488
Mark TestStatus as internal as it is only used by internal code
Add tests to cover improved colorized text box autosizing
Pass output-columns config down to the TestDox-printer
Fix single path test in GH action
Finish documenting single package approach, add rest of GH Actions
Add CI step for new app separate packages

issue.title: Add a version attribute to the XML configuration to facilitate migrating between major versions
issue.body: In 3.0 there are significant changes to the XML configuration file and schema. There isn't really anyway to determine which version of Annotated Container is suitable for. We should add an attribute `version` to the root `<annotatedContainer>` element that dictates which `major.minor` version this schema is intended for. This can be used both by humans manually checking configurations, tooling to verify your configuration file is for the version of your Annotated Container, and to provide migration tools in the future if they become necessary.

commits.message: Add version attribute to XML configuration (#389)

issue.title: Refactor functional API to return definitions and not be DefinitionProviderContext aware
issue.body:
Currently the functional API is a bit clunky and requires a `DefinitionProviderContext` be passed as the first argument. This is largely an artifact of dealing with an immutable data structure, the `ContainerDefinitionBuilder`, and needing to provide a solution for that. The solution provided in 2.x is less than ideal.

In 3.x the `DefinitionProviderContext` has been updated to expose more appropriate methods for adding the different types of definitions. This updated will allow us to change the functional API into one that's a bit easier to reason about. The functions should returns definitions that get added via the `DefinitionProviderContext`.

commits.message: Refactor functional API to not require DefinitionProviderContext (#388)

issue.title: Improve ability to cache a ContainerDefinition
issue.body:
Currently, the caching of a ContainerDefinition is only supported in storing a file on a local filesystem. In addition, there is no way to bust this cache without knowing internal implementation details on how the cache key is generated. In short, caching a ContainerDefinition is more a proof-of-concept as opposed to something truly production ready.

Instead of using PSR-6/16, to reduce the amount of dependencies we require, we will implement our own system. Users can choose to implement this new system using PSR-6/16 if they choose to do so. The interfaces designed for this system should be hyper-specific to the purpose of caching a ContainerDefinition object and later retrieving it.

issue.title: Allow Bootstrap to receive custom configuration
issue.body: Currently the Annotated Container configuration is an XML file. The Bootstrap requires this XML file to work properly. However, it is possible a user implements their own `BootstrappingConfiguration` instance and would like to use that. We should update the Bootstrap functionality to support this.
